intro: Leontodon clavatus, commonly known as the clustered toothgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the daisy family (Asteraceae). It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant features erect, sparsely branched stems with narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense, rounded cluster at the top of the stem. Leontodon clavatus is characterized by its distinctive seed heads, which are often mistaken for those of other similar species.
